intro: Pseudabutilon cymosum, commonly known as the clustered false abutilon, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a clustered pattern. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid tropical environments.
